00022 char *LITM_CODE_MESSAGES[] = {
00023                 "LITM_CODE_OK",
00024                 "LITM_CODE_NO_MESSAGE",
00025                 "LITM_CODE_BUSY",
00026                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_MALLOC",
00027                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_CONNECTION_OPEN",
00028                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION",
00029                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_NO_MORE_CONNECTIONS",
00030                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_BUS",
00031                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_SENDER_EQUAL_CURRENT",
00032                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_NO_CURRENT",
00033                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_SWITCH_NEXT_NOT_FOUND",

00035                 "LITM_CODE_BUSY_OUTPUT_QUEUE",
00036                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_INVALID_ENVELOPE",
00037                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_SUBSCRIPTION_NOT_FOUND",
00038                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_BUS_FULL",
00039                 "LITM_CODE_BUSY_CONNECTIONS",
00040                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_CONNECTION_NOT_ACTIVE",
00041                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_END_OF_SUBSCRIBERS_LIST",
00042                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_NO_SUBSCRIBERS",

00044                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_SUBSCRIPTION_ERROR",
00045                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_SEND_ERROR",
00046                 "LITM_CODE_ERROR_RECEIVE_WAIT"

00054         litm_code
00055 litm_connect(litm_connection **conn) {
00056 
00057         return litm_connect_ex( conn, 0);
00058 }//
00059 
00060         litm_code
00061 litm_connect_ex(litm_connection **conn, int id) {
00062 
00063         switch_init();
00064 
00065         litm_code code = litm_connection_open_ex(conn, id);
00066         if (LITM_CODE_OK!=code) {
00067                 *conn = NULL;
00068                 return code;
00069         }
00070 
00071         return LITM_CODE_OK;
00072 }
00073 
00074         litm_code
00075 litm_connect_ex_wait(litm_connection **conn, int id, int timeout) {
00076 
00077         litm_code code;
00078         struct timeval *start, *current;
00079         int computed_timeout = __litm_compute_timeout( timeout );
00080 
00081         while(1) {
00082 
00083                 code = litm_connect_ex(conn, id);
00084                 if (LITM_CODE_OK==code)
00085                         break;
00086 
00087                 // an error we can't handle here?
00088                 if (LITM_CODE_BUSY!=code) {
00089                         break;
00090                 }
00091 
00092                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "litm_connect_ex_wait: NEED TO RETRY id[%i]", id);
00093 
00094                 // at this point, we just back-off an retry
00095                 int result = random_sleep_period(       start,
00096                                                                                         current,
00097                                                                                         LITM_DEFAULT_MAX_BACKOFF*1000*1000,
00098                                                                                         computed_timeout);
00099                 // expired period?
00100                 if (1==result) {
00101                         code = LITM_CODE_ERROR_CONNECTION_ERROR;
00102                         break;
00103                 }
00104         }
00105 
00106         return code;
00107 }
00108 
00109         litm_code
00110 litm_disconnect(litm_connection *conn) {
00111 
00112         return litm_connection_close(conn);
00113 }//

00123         litm_code
00124 litm_subscribe_wait(litm_connection *conn, litm_bus bus_id, int timeout) {
00125 
00126         litm_code code;
00127         struct timeval *start, *current;
00128         int computed_timeout = __litm_compute_timeout( timeout );
00129 
00130         while(1) {
00131 
00132                 code = switch_add_subscriber( conn, bus_id );
00133                 if (LITM_CODE_OK==code)
00134                         break;
00135 
00136                 // an error we can't handle here?
00137                 if (LITM_CODE_BUSY!=code) {
00138                         break;
00139                 }
00140 
00141                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "litm_subscribe_wait: NEED TO RETRY conn[%x] bus[%i]", conn, bus_id);
00142 
00143                 // at this point, we just back-off an retry
00144                 int result = random_sleep_period(       start,
00145                                                                                         current,
00146                                                                                         LITM_DEFAULT_MAX_BACKOFF*1000*1000,
00147                                                                                         computed_timeout);
00148                 // expired period?
00149                 if (1==result) {
00150                         code = LITM_CODE_ERROR_SUBSCRIPTION_ERROR;
00151                         break;
00152                 }
00153 
00154         }
00155 
00156         return code;
00157 }//

00162         return switch_remove_subscriber( conn, bus_id );

00175         litm_code
00176 litm_send_wait( litm_connection *conn,
00177                                 litm_bus bus_id,
00178                                 void *msg,
00179                                 void (*cleaner)(void *msg),
00180                                 int timeout ) {
00181 
00182         litm_code code;
00183         struct timeval *start, *current;
00184         int computed_timeout = __litm_compute_timeout( timeout );
00185 
00186         while(1) {
00187 
00188                 code = switch_send(conn, bus_id, msg, cleaner);
00189                 if (LITM_CODE_OK==code)
00190                         break;
00191 
00192                 // an error we can't handle here?
00193                 if (LITM_CODE_BUSY!=code) {
00194                         break;
00195                 }
00196 
00197                 DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG, "litm_send_wait: NEED TO RETRY conn[%x][%3i] bus[%3i]", conn, conn->id, bus_id);
00198 
00199                 // at this point, we just back-off an retry
00200                 int result = random_sleep_period(       start,
00201                                                                                         current,
00202                                                                                         LITM_DEFAULT_MAX_BACKOFF*1000*1000,
00203                                                                                         computed_timeout);
00204                 // expired period?
00205                 if (1==result) {
00206                         code = LITM_CODE_ERROR_SEND_ERROR;
00207                         break;
00208                 }
00209 
00210         }
00211 
00212         return code;
00213 }//

00224 
00225 /**
00226  * Receive (non-blocking) function for clients
00227  *
00228  * \note It is the responsibility of the client
00229  *       to _not_ use this function once a
00230  *       connection is closed.
00231  *
00232  */
00233         litm_code
00234 litm_receive_nb(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope **envlp) {
00235 
00236         if (NULL==conn) {
00237                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00238         }
00239         int returnCode = LITM_CODE_OK; //optimistic
00240 
00241         *envlp = queue_get_nb( conn->input_queue );
00242         if (NULL==*envlp) {
00243                 returnCode=LITM_CODE_NO_MESSAGE;
00244         } else {
00245                 conn->received++;
00246         }
00247 
00248         return returnCode;
00249 }//
00250 
00251 /**
00252  * Receive with wait
00253  */
00254         litm_code
00255 litm_receive_wait(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope **envlp) {
00256 
00257         if (NULL==conn) {
00258                 return LITM_CODE_ERROR_BAD_CONNECTION;
00259         }
00260         int returnCode = LITM_CODE_OK; //optimistic
00261 
00262         while(1) {
00263 
00264                 // let's see first if we need to bother with the
00265                 // conditional waiting on the queue.
00266                 // This also takes care of the probability of
00267                 //  missing a signal for whatever reason
00268                 *envlp = queue_get_nb( conn->input_queue );
00269                 if (NULL!=*envlp) {
00270 
00271                         conn->received++;
00272                         break;
00273                 }
00274 
00275                 //give the chance to another thread
00276                 usleep(1);
00277                 //sched_yield();
00278 
00279                 int rc= queue_wait( conn->input_queue );
00280                 if (rc) {
00281                         returnCode = LITM_CODE_ERROR_RECEIVE_WAIT;
00282                         break;
00283                 }
00284                 // try again... this time around,
00285                 // we have been signaled that a message is
00286                 // ready... we should get lucky!
00287 
00288         }//while
00289 
00290         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"litm_receive_wait, STOP conn[%x]",conn);
00291         return returnCode;
00292 }//
00293 
00294 /**
00295  * Release a message to LITM
00296  *
00297  * This function should *ONLY* be used by client's
00298  *  as a result of finishing the processing of an
00299  *  envelope/message retrieved through ``litm_receive_nb''.
00300  *
00301  */
00302         litm_code
00303 litm_release(litm_connection *conn, litm_envelope *envlp) {
00304 
00305         return switch_release( conn, envlp );
00306 }//

00308 
00309         void *
00310 litm_get_message(litm_envelope *envlp) {
00311 
00312         if (NULL==envlp) {
00313                 return NULL;
00314         }
00315 
00316         return envlp->msg;
00317 }//
00318 
00319         char *
00320 litm_translate_code(litm_code code) {
00321 
00322         if ((sizeof(LITM_CODE_MESSAGES)/sizeof(char *)) <= code )
00323                 return NULL;
00324 
00325         return LITM_CODE_MESSAGES[code];
00326 }//
00327 
00328 /**
00329  * Translates a seconds based timeout to a
00330  * useconds timeout value whilst adjusting for
00331  * the default timeout value.
00332  *
00333  */
00334         int
00335 __litm_compute_timeout(int timeout) {
00336 
00337         int computed_timeout;
00338 
00339         // adjust to default
00340         if (0!=timeout) {
00341                 computed_timeout = timeout;
00342         } else {
00343                 computed_timeout = LITM_DEFAULT_MAX_TIMEOUT;
00344         }
00345         computed_timeout *= 1000*1000;
00346 
00347         return computed_timeout;
00348 }

00351         void
00352 litm_wait_shutdown(void){
00353 
00354         __switch_wait_shutdown();
00355
